verses.verse: O Lord <WH3068>, you have searched <WH2713> me <WH3045>, and known me.
You know <WH3045> my sitting <WH3427> and my standing <WH6965>, you understand <WH995> my thoughts <WH7454> afar off <WH7350>.
You search <WH2219> my path <WH734> and my lying down <WH7252>, and are acquainted <WH5532> with all my ways <WH1870>.
For there is not a word <WH4405> in my tongue <WH3956>, but <WH3068>, behold, O Lord, you know it altogether <WH3045>.
You have beset <WH6696> me behind <WH268> and before <WH6924>, and laid <WH7896> your hand upon me <WH3709>.
Such knowledge <WH1847> is too wonderful <WH6383> for me <WH7682>; it is high, I cannot attain unto it <WH3201>.
Where shall I go <WH3212> from your spirit <WH7307>? or where shall I flee <WH1272> from your presence <WH6440>?
If I ascend up <WH5266> into heaven <WH8064>, you are there <WH3331>: if I make my bed in hell <WH7585>, behold, you are there.
If I take <WH5375> the wings <WH3671> of the morning <WH7837>, and live <WH7931> in the outermost parts <WH319> of the sea <WH3220>;
Even there shall your hand <WH3027> lead <WH5148> me <WH3225>, and your right hand shall hold me <WH270>.
If I say <WH559>, Surely the darkness <WH2822> shall cover <WH7779> me <WH3915>; even the night shall be light <WH216> about me <WH1157>.
Yes <WH2822>, the darkness hides <WH2821> not from you <WH3915>; but the night shines <WH215> as the day <WH3117>: the darkness <WH2825> and the light are both alike to you <WH219>.
For you have possessed <WH7069> my minds <WH3629>: you have covered <WH5526> me in my mother <WH517>'s womb <WH990>.
I will praise <WH3034> you <WH3372>; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made <WH6395>: marvelous <WH6381> are your works <WH4639>; and that my soul <WH5315> knows <WH3045> right well <WH3966>.
My substance <WH6108> was not hid <WH3582> from you <WH6213>, when I was made in secret <WH5643>, and curiously done <WH7551> in the lowest parts <WH8482> of the earth <WH776>.

Your eyes <WH5869> did see <WH7200> my substance <WH1564>, yet being unperfect; and in your book <WH5612> all my members were written <WH3789>, which in continuance <WH3117> were fashioned <WH3335>, when as yet there was none of them <WH259>.
How precious <WH3365> also are your thoughts <WH7454> unto me <WH410>, O God! how great <WH6105> is the sum of them <WH7218>!
If I should count <WH5608> them <WH7235>, they are more in number than the sand <WH2344>: when I awake <WH6974>, I am still with you <WH5750>.
Surely you will kill <WH6991> the wicked <WH7563>, O God <WH433>: depart <WH5493> from me therefore <WH1818>, you bloody men <WH582>.
For they speak <WH559> against you wickedly <WH4209>, and your enemies <WH6145> take <WH5375> your name in vain <WH7723>.
Do not I hate <WH8130> them <WH3068>, O Lord, that hate <WH8130> you <WH6962>? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against you <WH8618>?
I hate <WH8130> them with perfect <WH8503> hatred <WH8135>: I count them my enemies <WH341>.
Search <WH2713> me <WH410>, O God, and know <WH3045> my heart <WH3824>: try <WH974> me <WH3045>, and know my thoughts <WH8312>:
And see <WH7200> if there be any wicked <WH6090> way <WH1870> in me <WH5148>, and lead me in the way <WH1870> everlasting <WH5769>.
